U43oOnlhmeLU-YQM6zRa5Q.text: Came here with my wife and a friend for lunch so it wasn't very busy. We were getting weird looks from the hostesses as soon as we walked in. Kaylah, our waitress was very nice and did a very good job. I didn't expect to be stared at by the hostesses the entire time we were there. The food was alright for the price. Pulled pork sandwich with mac n cheese. Nothing too special about it. My wife had the wings and they were alright. Not bland, it was well seasoned. Meanwhile the hostesses still staring and whispering to each other. I'll come back again for the wings most likely because my wife enjoyed them.

sZ26oiTF_2VO2dqj0Qfgvg.text: In town for ACC championship game. Waited in the bar for 2.5 hours and was told when we came in they could not take reservations for over 4 people. We reserved a table for 4 to speed up the process with two people standing.  Numerous tables were seated with 6+ people with less wait time less than we were quoted for only 4 people, how can that be?Establishment needs more staff. Very poor encounter for out of town visitors. Go across the way to World of Beer.

ynYmIBTx2PlE4V3VhCczng.text: This place absolutely sucks!!!!!! The waitress was on her second week there and obviously overwhelmed bc she was the only one waiting tables. 9 people behind the bar serving drinks. Food was ok when it finally came drinks took forever even with all those people behind the bar and were weak and not worth the money. Absolutely will never step foot back in Whiskey River ever again!!!!!

IXaz7WZg6jns5qUbh-qsXQ.text: Had a $60 gift card to Whisky River so I brought my friends in one night with me, we ordered one bucket of beers and decided we wanted to go somewhere else. Upon opening the tab, I gave the gift card to the bartender who said she will hold on to it until we close the tab. When we were all finished, I went to close the tab and the waiter claims "she set the gift card down and someone must've taken it". We had to pay. Considering this was HER fault, we should've been comped and given a new gift card. Will never go back again.

Ld2kPP7yi2njvW0rjly66w.text: We went before a concert. Had a drink and nachos.  I would say they were ballpark worthy at best. The drinks were good, but I'm not really sure there was any alcohol on them.  They were packed, but the service was definitely less than stellar.  Waiting for plates was something that shouldn't happen.  With all the other options so close by, we won't be back.

aV_K8ChmYeqJhwpAk1zwMg.text: Great service from *heather*  We fly every weekend and stop by whisky river each time for the months since they opened at RDU. Heather is the first server who was pleasant and welcoming. She understands flight times and gets our order to us. Kudos!!! Will ask for her each visit !!!

WlCyIcS-5I8deSAis5ui3A.text: The wings are awesome! Big and meaty. The atmosphere is good and not much of a wait. Highly recommend

wyhB2owESTaEuiWQy1PhOg.text: Probably the worst burger of any sports bar ever.   For a place the be that empty right before an NbA game across the street, we should have known it would be bad.  Our server was very nice But service was slow.   Dishes sat in front of us until we left.  The guy who "ran food" couldn't have been any less interested. Overall an embarrassing place to take customers.

MRPCm_BYEHl2T9oNZYnCbQ.text: Pros: Fun atmosphere, great for people watching, mechanical bull is unique in my experience  Cons: I had the chicken tenders and fries and while the tenders were alright, the fries were pretty terrible. I've had fries that didn't taste good before, but these were the first fries I've experienced that actually tasted bad. After dinner, I felt sick and had to drink lots of water to get the taste out of my mouth. Would not go again!

b_KRL1VkF--IhZCV9pWgVA.text: This place has a great variety of meals for everyone. The shrimp volcano wrap was insanely great. This is a great group spot for a picky group. All 6 of us enjoyed the meal. From pastas to burgers to seafood. We all got what we wanted.

WoFULsgUMf3e1-0Q1euzvw.text: First off, I hate bar/grills. There's not a bar/grill in existence that can trill me. Just wanted to preface my review with that little note.  Because I dislike these establishments I should've known better when my travel companions suggested Whiskey River to remedy our starvation mode. But you know the saying, "Desperate times call for desperate measures." Against my better judgement I went along and the service was horrific!   Sure it was a game night so the place was packed but they were also properly staffed with servers, bartenders and I'd think cooks. Our server took FOREVER to come take our order, FOREVER to bring drinks & silverware, FOREVER, to get the food out to us, NEVER came back to see how things were, NEVER returned for drink refills, NEVER... Never mind you get the point.   Single star for location, Epicentre is pretty happening. If you like loud, drunkard behavior, slow service, beer on tap, a mechanical bull and large TV's for game-watching this is your place.   ~Christy, not so much.

ULXjOgh4UHVfoavdKvbR-w.text: I thought this was a pretty decent place.   I came to watch part of the super bowl here earlier this month, and all the servers were pretty friendly. Nothing special or out of the ordinary, but there wasn't anything bad about my experience here.   They have quite a few screens in case you want to come here and watch football or basketball, so you'll be covered on that front. The drink prices also aren't to bad, but being from NY, maybe I'm used to paying more for alcohol in the first place- not sure if North Carolinians are used to paying different prices.

yRx2chroF5Zlb-S98mQWEA.text: Be prepared for the slowest service ever!  We recently traveled out of state and while giggling places near us this place popped up and seemed interesting since it's a Dale thing so we tried it. Now I will take into consideration that there was a concert that night and this place was super packed. We waited an hour for a table. Once seated our waitress came and took our drink order and when she brought them back we gave her our food order. And that's the last we saw of her. Other people brought out our apps and main meal. I ordered the smothered chicken which was so over cooked I couldn't even cut it with a knife. My friends chicken sandwich...she couldn't even bite into it. And my poor son who ordered ribs which are suppose to fall off of the bone  he tried cutting the meat off. Didn't work. Tried biting it off. That didn't work. Needless to say his ribs went untouched because the meat was literally glued To the bone! It was the worst almost $100 I have ever spent on food! Not to mention with our waitress never bothering to at least check on us once we sat there for a good 45-60 minutes trying to flag someone down so that we could get our check. The service is absolutely terrible. I said I understand that were packed but come on you know you have a table at least make sure everything is ok.

FBCgNNp8YCm_v1LqZ4nRSA.text: The food was decent and the wings had great flavor but they were the smallest wings I've ever had out to eat. For over a dollar a wing it's genuinely unacceptable for their size. Also, no gameday specials was a little disappointing. That aside the flavor was good.

KEG44-Y2ewyikjQkSZLBzg.text: Wayyy too many people crowded into this place. There was no service it was basically arguing and fighting for a beer. It shouldn't have been allowed to operate in such a manner. Never again.

g42gbochFcuWvr2k2EUxcw.text: My group stopped here as we were in between flights. The burger I got was ok. I thought the description made burger I had sound better than it was. Overall not a bad place

UtVkzfWIArqXhggXzonasA.text: I was surprised and relieved to find that Whisky River is not a shrine to Dale Earnhardt Jr. Still, it's a haven for his adoring middle-aged fans and very much a tourist trap. There is even a stand selling Whisky River T-shirts, hats and other merchandise.   If you're not into NASCAR, you definitely shouldn't go during a race, which dominates all 20 TVs in the bar.   Whisky River is a private club, so if you're going for the first time, you'll have to go through the annoying process of waiting in line and filling out a membership form. You'll also have to pay a cover to get in.  Unlike other EpiCentre hotspots, Whisky River's crowd isn't very dressed up. Most women wear jeans and halter tops; most guys wear jeans, collared shirts and baseball caps.    With three large bars and several beer tubs, there are plenty of spots to get a drink in the smoky, packed bar. And I'll admit that watching people (mostly women) tackle the mechanical bull can be entertaining.   A big plus is that it's right off the light rail.

photos.caption: Photo of Dale Jr.'s Whisky River - Charlotte, NC, United States

BS5yu0NBhHi_L7IQAErBmg.text: If you like $12 well mixed drinks and $15 top shelf single drinks then this is the place for you! All pre-frozen bar food from your local US Foods or Sysco. Crowd is scary after nightfall. You've been warned.

g2RHxe8HJbdtbLUBUpF7Wg.text: Don't remember all very well but I know it's more of a young relaxed crowd that frequent this club. Whisky River comes with a country vibe to it. I first came in here back in '08 or '09 with some friends in which I got us a table and had a fun time dancing and watching drunk chicks get on some mechanical bull they have in there yeah fun time.  Now, move forward to 2011. After hanging out at Kazba which turned out to be a let down, I tried to get into this club with friends from NC. Got to the door and my friends were fine to go in but not me. The guy at the entrance didn't believe my Nevada ID was real. Informed him I was visiting from LV. He asked me what's the address on it and before I could tell him, he said no, you're not getting in with this... haha dude cracked me up!  The trip to charlotte ended up being weird. I was in the twilight zone, what a bummer.

c4bxC-agqw5vScIBPVg7uw.text: We visited Whiskey River on a Saturday. It served as the after party spot for a friends birthday party that had taken place a few hours earlier. We hung out in the VIP section because of the group of people that were with us. The waitress was nice. She brought a bottle and poured everyone's drinks up. The DJ was good. He played a nice variety of music. Whiskey River has a large space. Most people where near the bar or on the dance floor. Laid back atmosphere. It's located in the Epicenter, which is an attractive space for nightlife. It's located close to the Charlotte Hornets/Time Warner arena, so folks flock to the area after concerts and games. I'd go back. We had a blast.

VFA8UbiTtnxJBZqMBLgWLQ.text: I think my review is based mainly on the fact that I'm over the age limit to be in here.  We came about a month ago with some friends to go dancing.  We got all decked out, had too many drinks at home and off we went.  The place is so crowded you can't move on the dance floor at all.  My husband is almost 6'5" and kept getting ran into by teeny tiny girls who had no regard for their surroundings or people around them.  After about an hour of this we headed out to another bar with less people and more room.  Bottom line - if you are under 25, or out on the town for a bachelorette party this is the place to be...ride the mechanical bull, dance in uncomfortable confines and shoes....regret it in the morning.  If not, head somewhere else!

wn3YSYXVfV-LqZRlJ2B5lw.text: Went to WR for a couple of drinks before the Bobcats game, I forgot my card there and picked it up on the way out after the game.  Before I got home, I had an email from American Express saying that someone had cloned my card and used it in my hometown 500 miles away and spent almost $2200!!  This is in less than 3 hours.  Not sure what they are doing there but I will definitely not be using my credit card at this bar ever again.

JhdZNzoD3N1C75YcHLUP4w.text: Had a VIP evening here for night 1 of my Brother in-law's bachelor weekend.  The service was good and there a was a real party atmosphere.

7iDSXtX_Z8YMK6Nh_9uBrQ.text: I feel like there are three things important for a club: music, crowd, and drinks.   Whiskey plays decent music. Some days better than the others depending on the DJ. The crowd is alright too. I feel like if you go with a good group of friends, even the worst club can be super fun. The drinks are not bad, decently priced.   It's pretty casual and it's a big space right in the middle of the EpiCenter.   My advice: get a fun group of friends and you are all set!

N6vzCrVtJNk67Q3WLY1Cpg.text: Went to whisnky rive for St pangricks bare crawl! Wow all the people! even got dizzy a little from all the dancing wow! Next day watched Phoenix NASCAR race andd Dale JR almost won past harvike! Dame cation at the end screwed JR man!

LVDw4vIcZ6E22IjtVtp1tg.text: A sports bar the Epicenter. Drinks are reasonably priced, at least from the East Coast's perspective..! There's a mechanical bull that was loads of fun. The dance floor opens up later in the evening as well.   There is a cover.

oKIhuSPt5Vd8Oq5cnJP66g.text: We went there for a quick bite to eat and to cross it off our list on the Bar Crawl we were doing for the Champions cup. The place was very large and pretty crowded but a great atmosphere. They had big projector screens showing the match and they even have a mechanical bull. We got the chicken tenders as an app and they were okay. They were thinner and flatter then the usual tenders I am used to but they were pretty good still. They had a $5 guiness beer special going on also. I would go back if I am in town again to watch some sports games!

BVVzyhNV2lefASnwoz6iuw.text: This place is fun, but really more of a college aged crowd.  And to counter Melissa......ALL WOMEN SHOULD GET ON THE BULL.....more than once would be best *evil grin*.  It should be a stop off among many in a night of partying......if you approach this place that way you should have a good time!

JClcyC0mPwF8fxj6Jtvfog.text: Don't waste your time. Overpriced, boring, and full of drunk grenades. Customer service is awful.   My buddy and I decided we would go since they were offering free cover before 11pm. We arrived 10 minutes after 11, and although our whole party had arrived, they still charged 7 to walk through the door. We decided we would just go to Mez or Kazbah so went to leave. A friend came out and begged us to stay, so we decided to bite the bullet and pay cover (the last time we had went it sucked so we were apprehensive).  We went to the line, and the manager said he wasn't letting people in for a minute. We had already been carded 5 minutes before but he decided to make us wait and be ID'ed again. 15 minutes goes by as they are checking in more and more grenades from the VIP line, and then we are finally let in.   Within 5 minutes my friend and I had dropped over $30 on 2 drinks and cover. The wait at the bar was another 10 minutes. My 3 goals entering the bar was beer, shot, bathroom. I completed my mission at 11:50, 40 minutes into my one and only Saturday night of the week. What a waste of time.  The music was awful, Rod Stewart, really?? I didn't hear one song that I haven't heard a million times before. We retreated to the smoking area, the only part of the place I found bearable. There was an amazing amount of girls that could not hold their liquor acting trashed out there. Not normal trashed, more like first-time-I-ever-drank-so-I-decided-to-chug-a-bottle-of-everclear trashed. Words of wisdom: No one wants to do you if you are a puke time bomb.  We asked if everyone wanted to go somewhere else for a drink and dropped Kazbah as an idea and a girl walks up with the heaviest accent ever and says "Kaaazbuh? Eww, isnt thAt a PUURSHUN place?!" ...... that sentence sums up my recommendation. If you have an aversion to 'PUURSHUN' places, please keep the rest of uptown fun and go to Whisky River! Otherwise, don't waste your time.

ahtdYeZNgCoLZqyrAC9nFg.text: My husband and I walked in, stood in the entrance for quite sometime waiting to be seated. Nobody approached us and the only staff we saw was one bartender. We walked away and will never return.

QZhhkl-UIhF4IOWx4uYcKA.text: Calling all cheeseball 20 yr olds find your Ed Hardy shirts or your plaid button-downs tucked into your faded jeans.  Seriously.  Ladies dont get on the bull.  It just isnt hot.  Period.  I dont care how hot or drunk you are, it is just embarrassing....horrifying....if your mother could see you now...you would be in BIG trouble young lady!   The only thing I can say positive about this place is that they have my beer there and you get a lot of free drinks because the VIP lounge looks down on the bar by the dancefloor.  Just know what you are getting into when you walk in the door.  Ug!

4-IJhXNSCxxjyF9EXyexhA.text: Just go ahead and get rid of the rude cover charge girl (blonde). She literally YELLS at everyone walking in and is generally unpleasant. We walked right out after our initial interaction with her!! Across the Epicenter we were warmly welcomed by every other establishment. Go to this place if you want to be treated like you're belligerent when in fact you're sober :)

vriX_4v1PpwDuCMyFLlJDA.text: Great bar.......   the food ? Eh not so much. Stopped by with some friends from out of town. Disappointed with the food. Friends flatbreads were burnt black on the bottom. My burger was not as ordered. Great place with a great location but the kitchen needs tightened up ! At least the beer was cold !! Bartender was excellent. Manager made everything right. Good guy !

Ugktyk_ZSlkkP_EwZILEuQ.text: Horrible service. I was in town for some training and wanted to try it out. There were no more than 10 people in the bar at 6:30p on a Monday night. We waited 5-6 mins until someone finally acknowledged us waiting to be seated. There were two in my party but we were on given one menu. We shared that one menu for about 10 minutes and when we still hadn't been helped we decided to leave. You would think with the Hornets hosting the Bulls this place would have been slammed. Maybe the locals knew something I didn't.

gQEKlFhaSWgmAN1BSUNzeQ.text: Fun place to go out in Charlotte, very popular so its always busy but its in no way a great place. Over priced bud lights, ok music.. i've experienced better. Of course its the crowd that makes it fun so if you're with a group of friends give it a shot.. oh by the way theres a cover charge. which sucks.

djD7ovU865v7ETjRs9Vw0Q.text: I'm sure this place doesn't survive on folks eating lunch there on the weekend. But I'm gone a few times during some slow periods - and the food was mighty good.  The burgers can hold their own with anyone in town. Plenty of tasty fries, nice service. Watched some NASCAR on TV. A solid choice.

dnBdo-AnDQ9LEqeX83tfpw.text: Started here for our brunch crawl.  As the host of this event you would have thought there would have been better direction to the day. Instead they let the app be what we used to figure it out.   Upon arrival I was immediately uncomfortable as we were never offered anything.  The three of us literally stood there looking lost yet trying to fit in. It was only noon so hard to judge the overall atmosphere of the bar scene.   We stayed for only a few minutes as we felt like outcasts.  We thought we would go outside and work to figure it out.  Want to return as I have only heard good things about this bar....just not impressed with their hostess abilities.

jAfQAx5-Xh5UgwXCZmFyhQ.text: What a great BIG bar! Loads of tv to watch sports and there's even a mechanical bull!   & the wings?! My goodness so delicious and fulfilling!

photos.caption: Photo of Dale Jr.'s Whisky River - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo Wings and Sweet Chilli Wings

J3Uat00Dar1qHBXI0AD-xg.text: A group of friends and I came here this past Saturday for the Rum Fest in the Epicentre. We paid $20 for one signature drink at 4 different establishments. Whisky River was the third establishment. When we tried to get our complimentary drink from the bar, they proceeded to tell us that they "ran out" of the alochol for the drink, but we could purchase others for the "special" price of $5. Now if you run out of something that people pay for, why would you try to supplement this with something for another charge? Sounds phishy to me. This was the only bar who did this, and we were extremely displeased with the service. Thanks for not holding up your end of the special. We will NOT be returning here again.

tv5BZjpi2mak0YHntYwelg.text: Food was your typical bar food... appetizers, burgers, sandwiches, etc.  Service was good and the bartenders were friendly.  I gave it only 1 star because while there we witnessed two employees wrapping utensils in an unsanitary manor. The utensils were being handled with bare hands...  being picked up by the tops of the utensils that a customer would be putting into their mouth.   It's pretty disgusting not knowing if the employees hands were clean or not.

hTWTBeb48J_PolsLhPzthg.text: Came here to watch the Nets playoffs vs 76's on April 13, 2019 and this was my first time at this establishment. The wings were phenomenal (see attached photo) and there were dozens of tv's all over the restaurant that allowed for multiple viewings of different things!

photos.caption: Photo of Dale Jr.'s Whisky River - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Thai Chili and Garlic Parmesan Wings

Due to this being a "Private Establishment" they would be fined because a 34yr old woman has a state ID from NY. So all 8...yep EIGHT of us had to leave. A huge percentage of New Yorkers don't have driver licenses so a GIaNT  middle finger to this "Private Establishment " with the dumb rules. When a law is unfair or nonsensical, business owners should challenge it vs nimbly stating "it's the law" We walked across the hall to another bar and had NO problem. So again...a big middle finger to the restaurant with the DUmB rules

yBH_YnNdxSuUPk2jUs4S3Q.text: You know, good bar but their food selection is really sub-par.   I'm not going back there for food.    Everything seemed frozen, thawed, and heated up.

eqDpBWYORY_HLr8PL79EPg.text: If I could give 0 stars I would. Took 45- minutes to get cheap tortilla chips with Pace picante "salsa". (Living overseas, it was the only salsa we could get and that taste is engrained in my memory.) Awful!!!  The cheese dip is any microwavable dip you buy in the grocery store. 2- minutes after the "appetizers" were served, I got my poor excuse for a "Killer Club". 3- slices of processed, packaged "ham" and 3- slices of that same crap only a different color, called "turkey". ( Seriously, think Oscar Meyer bologna.) It even had the slime from the package. I could have easily made that in my hotel room and had it taste better. Sorry excuse for calling it restaurant food. Dale Jr. ought to fire whoever thought the menu was good and disassociate with this piss-poor restaurant.

-f_3OtWlhw8XN9OpuZk4DA.text: I was nervous because of the low ratings on Yelp! But I love Dale and had to do it. And I love the surprise coupon. Thanks Yelp!  We got nachos for an appetizer with chicken. They were the typical bar food appetizer. Not bad.   I got the ribs. They were fall off the bone tender.  BBQ sauce on the side. Crispy fries and the mac n cheese was good. Nothing spectacular but not bad at all.  Don't forget your souvenir t-shirts!

_WSogPdul18KZuX-G-ZV5g.text: Came for the nightclub part of the establishment.  Draconianly strict dress code policy that is selectively enforced. Many of these rules seem obviously geared towards African American culture (none of these: loose attire, huge logos, flashy shoes/clothes, hats in any direction other than forward, visible necklaces, athletic wear, do rags). The only reason I bothered giving the place a shot was to perhaps try out the mechanical bull, which was not used by many - there was never a line to use it. The unwelcoming bull operator was likely the cause of this.  The DJ was HORRENDOUS. The genre of music constantly changed, nearly every couple songs with no thought seemingly given to as what songs were played. I had more fun dancing to 80s/90s music, which I never listen to, at another nightclub than the selection given at Whiskey River.  The bartenders wore very revealing attire, the bottom halves of their butt cheeks were clearly visible. Trashy and embarrassing to bring along someone with a ounce of class. This is very at odds with any excuse for their targeted dress code possibly being in place to require their patrons be dressed nicely. The drinks were nothing to write home about.  The venue was beautiful, although unoriginal.  You know it is a sad club when the most entertaining part of the night was some guy in the dance floor with a cowbell. There are much better places in the Epicenter to visit. The only time I'd ever go back is if every other club in the world vanished over night.

jVYYz9Te5z7YMHsI9Z9L6A.text: Ate here after the Belk Bowl. Beer is cold and that's the only good thing I have to say about the place. The chairs are wobbly, the bathrooms are dirty but the cherry on top is ordering buffalo CHICKEN dip and it tasting like buffalo CRAB dip. It was exactly like biting into week old fish-barf! Sent it back after two bites and they still tried to charge us for it. They should stick to being a bar because the food is no bueno

Ms7AIETwe2yzD1dTfpfjPQ.text: Cool spot at the Epi center. When you come in your greeted. I sat at the bar. Staff are nice. The place plays all kinds of music so you can't get into a groove. They will play country, rock, old school hip hop, pop, etc. when you check in on yelp you get a free appetizer. We got the spinach dip which came with rainbow chips. Don't get it. It tastes like a creamy paste. They have several televisions with music videos to the game. Drink prices are decent and the drinks are tasty. The restrooms are clean. It's a nice sports bar spot to try. I'll go back in passing, but not a place I know I will return to. It's basic and they aren't known for anything.

HNtA6lo0MQVK0_rCy5X_8g.text: Quite a disappointing experience. Came in on a Tuesday evening with a colleague for dinner. Waited a bit for the hostess to figure out what to do with us. There were plenty of tables but for some reason she wanted to sit us at the bar, which isn't what we wanted and that seemed to confuse her. We were finally sat at a table, which wasn't the cleanest table I'd ever been at and as we sat there for a bit waiting for someone to pay us some attention, we decided we'd take ourselves and our money elsewhere. I'm glad we did after reviewing the other yelp reviews, which frankly, I should have done first.

8iHCmUCPK9M6efHLGlQ68g.text: Interesting place. Long line to get in, no idea why because there was plenty of space inside, but the line moved quickly. $7 cover...where do you think  you are?? A bigger city? Please. At least I didn't have to pay for that ish.  First round of drinks were served in small plastic cups, lame. Second round were actually served in slightly bigger glasses. How does this place get away with that?  Mechanical bull..anyone ever get an STD from riding a mechanical bull? Because I'm sure you would if you mounted this one after all those other ladies finished grinding up on the hand hold.  Huge dance floor with a raised platform at the end of it. Perfect perch for all the creepers. Music was horribly mixed top 40s with a few popular 80s songs (i.e. Journey).   The only reason why I'm giving this place one star more than 1? TVs all around the dance floor so I can watch the NBA playoffs.

m72ukWQIiz8rWFp8xwMGcw.text: Bartender with the tattoos was awesome! Took care of us both nights we were here! Great environment and the staff was very nice!

Yc0q_4iNYKBKlCfEJmafhw.text: I went here simply to kill some time on a Thursday night and they had a free band playing, can't remember his name but he was new and on the radio and they were great.  The Bartender was even better, can't remember his name but he was very funny, joked around with you, knew how to give crap and take it, quick with drinks, and just overall a great bartender.  They had Yuengling Beer which I totally forgot because I am from Minnesota and can't get that there and I was excited about that.  Prices were great, met more people from out of town, great atmosphere, I would highly recommend this place to everyone.  I didn't eat here so I can't rate that but I did try the mechanical bull (Of course I didn't last long on that).  Love this place!

TAQkSWvJ7_qyV4B4DH4n4Q.text: I don't normally go to clubs with riding bulls but I must admit I've been here a few times.  It's a favorite hang out joint for southern folks.  I'm being nice by not using the term RED but I can because I'm from the south.    Last time I was here I had to do shots just to get in the groove because the drinks being made were pretty much pointless and watered down.    Being that this place is right in the Epicenter it's just and easy drop in during AA5 sometimes.  That's about the only reason I've ever even walked into the place.

MW1HTZpZH-GV32vmuXIU-A.text: Having never been to Charlotte, we chose to eat at the Epicentre. We chose Whiskey River out of a few other options. We were seated at a window table overlooking the city- awesome! Our server was all out of sorts. We ordered the nachos as an appetizer. They came out quickly but were so disappointing. Very little toppings and super flimsy chips. The guac that was supposed to come on the side came as a dollop on top. We were starving and finished quickly. We ordered burgers. Waited an hour. No burgers. The waitress came out and told us that our order never printed in the kitchen. They comped our burgers and had them out within 10 minutes. They were delicious, as were the fries. The atmosphere is not all that great and even for us as a young couple, the young kids at the bar were obnoxious. And the mechanical bull was directly behind our table, super distracting.

44kiGpCOem_tHL1m4zv9iw.text: Meh. I've been here before but it's been years. Friends were in town and this is where they wanted to go, so we went. Didn't have to pay cover thanks to some hospitality passes, at least. Overpriced drinks, impossible crowds, blah music turned up really loud. This seems to be the place to go for your bachelorette party though, as we saw 4 or 5 groups. The bartenders were attentive and friendly, I will give them that.   While we're on the subject of bartenders, I understand the purpose and desire of scantily-clad women bartenders, but I do think they have gone a step too far with the shot girls' uniforms, or lack of uniforms. When there's more cheek than pants, I think it's time for new pants. I've seen more cloth on cocktail servers at an actual strip club. And what are the male staff members wearing? Cleancut polo shirts and long pants.

Da1-pX6ayESWGvl3qkjd6A.text: We have come here a few times and have always had a great time. The free bull rides are great and the guy that runs it is really friendly. (if you want to stay on a while make sure to put on a show on the bull).   This was the first time we've made it on the dance floor. It was packed. If you like being crammed in to dance then this is a great place. I personally don't like such a packed floor but it was still a good time.

0DvSYwVVgK5hptBstEaloQ.text: Went Thursday night for dinner before the TSO concert. I had read reviews before we got there. A lot of them were right. Especially about the service or lack there of. We were seated and waited about 10 mins for our waiters to grace us with her presence. She didn't introduce herself or anything. I asked for a drink menu and was informed they didn't have one. We ordered margaritas and they were actually very good. 20 mins later she came to take our food order. Ordered fried pickles, club sandwich and a spinach flatbread. It was ok not great. We were given our check way before we were ready to go. They wanted our table to "Reserve". It made our waitress made when we told her we weren't ready to leave. We stayed 20 more minutes and got dirty looks. We watched "less attractive" people being turned away after 6 pm. Even though the alcohol was good, we won't be back

w3QN41kKAQaaxRsSbvkiQg.text: I cannot recommend this place  food was below average and the service was worse.  We had a group function, all had to sit separately, two people left because they couldn't sit where the game was visible and two others left because a son couldn't sit at the bar with his dad and eat.  Katrina, my waitress, forgot my order and brought us the wrong drinks three times.  Next time I'm back in Charlotte, I will not be entertaining here.  Sorry.

Al9icXaipRTYH3d3EiMmjw.text: Went on a Friday night. Fun sports bar atmosphere. Mechanical bull riding was entertaining to watch. Lots of TVs. Good music, not too loud and was early enough in the night the rush hadn't started (yet). Clean bathroom with an attendant.

3Or657uvtsvQ4QyVYchEBQ.text: I went here Saturday night with some friends.  We were visiting from Raleigh and knew that the EpiCenter was the place to go. I checked the reviews on this place and it didn't look too promising, but everyone else wanted to go ride the bull and dance, so I followed suit.  The cover is $7 on a Saturday night which in my opinion is WAY too high for a place that charges so much for their drinks. I got a vodka cranberry and my boyfriend got a beer, and it was $10.50. wow.  Thankfully because I checked in I got in for free as part of their check in offer. SCORE!  Anyways, the place was absolutely packed, there were people everywhere and it took forever to get around. Fortunately they had beer coolers set up around the bar, and there was two bars with quick bartenders, so getting a drink wasn't too difficult.    We got in line for the bull first. Now I've ridden the bull in Raleigh at City Limits, and its a good time.  After seeing the way its ran at Whisky Rivers I decided to opt out of the adventure.  First off the man who is running it makes it very obvious who he thinks is attractive and who he doesn't.  The girls who he didn't have the hots for were thrown off after a few seconds.  The more attractive girls were up there forever,  the bull barely moving expect for vibrating, which of course made the whole experience look completely provocative. There were a few guys who got up there, although it was mostly just drunk girls.  After exiting the line for the bull we went to the dance floor. The DJ was playing good dance music, top 40s with a few country songs thrown in here and there. I had a good time dancing to the music but it was difficult because there were people bumping into us every few seconds, which is to be expected at a place like this.  Girls, the bathroom only had three stalls, they don't restock the toilet paper and the line moves very slowly. Be Warned.  Needless to say this isn't the most fun I've ever had a dance club, but it was a good time. If you are looking for that crazy loud, crowded club scene, this is your place on a Saturday night.

ADYAYGXmFbuNvI_fHa4Bwg.text: Fun bar/club with good music. Reasonably priced and definitely one of the most fun spots in Uptown Charlotte. No drama, which is a huge plus! Everyone is just here to have fun and enjoy themselves!

gEMRsrgiDpfzmDghzEOMfw.text: Meh. I was here for a private party. It's a large space. Plenty of room to move around. The stage area was alright, but far from good. There were plenty of bars, so getting a drink was always easy. The beer selection was meh. The food spread was pretty awful. I can't say how it would be here on a typical night. However, based on my private party experience, I would go in with low expectations.

7MUTw2YJNH9OuXZRae0dNg.text: This place had great music, dancing and drinks!  We enjoyed a ladies night out and had so much fun!  I will definitely go to this club again!

sYlYdtGWDjlvkPud4LBBaQ.text: Fun night out dancing. Overpriced cover and drinks. Good mix of people of all ages. Dj was a bit odd - went on Friday night and he rotated playing half an hour of awesome music followed by 15 min of Ingrid Michelson, which of course cleared the floor because no one knew how to dance to it. I would go back if someone else suggested it, but might try some other spots first.

lzjQZhtEk0mDGQ_hx1DGAg.text: Really a disappointing place. Stopped in with my parents after visiting the NASCAR hall of fame. Figured JR's place had to be good. So wrong. Service was extremely slow. BhZcou_V69ttbWQUFWO2Jg.text: We stopped in here with 3 for lunch during the world cup. The food is not that great. It's OK, but clearly came out of a can or was pre-made without any preparation for the meal. Appetizers are ALL fried and their dishes come with HUGE portions that aren't really appropriate.   The bar seemed fun, although we were here during lunch and on a Sunday so it was pretty quiet. However, because the game was going on the service was TERRIBLE. Our waitress barely stopped to check in on us and took over 20 minutes to return our check after we asked for it. All the waitresses were just hanging around and talking to each other or flirting with a group of guys at the bar and not waiting on the ~8 tables that were seated.   Will probably not be back any time soon.

Jo5nrXeS4uSvDYWO-FbWBg.text: I didn't rate for the food. It's your average airport food. When you want to drink a few beers between flights, this is your place. Good live entertainment and excellent bar service.

tzBoXO35g0U-L91hyMBW7Q.text: Came in for a drink at the bar and decided to have dinner. Their female bartenders played on their phones and ate behind the bar while we sought out male bartenders to bring us drinks. Food was subpar - disappointing.

lNEcJf8jyjvizZQFW2BcuA.text: A lot of strong opinions on this place as to be expected.  That's what happens when you're on the of the biggest places in the Epicenter.   I've been here multiple times- sometimes with friends, sometimes alone, sometimes just to watch a game, sometimes to dance, sometimes just to get drunk.  For those who've had bad experiences I don't doubt their story but don't think it's the norm.  Again big place, lots of staff, a club, bar and restaurant so there's bound to be a couple staff members who aren't up to par.  For the most parts I've found most of the staff at least average with only a couple exceptional.  Food- it will never be a place where someone asks where you do want to go for dinner people will yell "Whiskey River!".  It's okay.  Never been overly impressed or overly disappointed.  But again in a place like this I'm sure there will be a few people who have those feelings.  But I would imagine the majority of people who go here have an "a-ok" time (as that's what Yelp calls a 3 star rating).  But if you go there depending on the night, how much you drink, who you go with it, etc. it may be entirely possible you have a 5 star evening or a 1 star evening.  But you never know until you try.

JkDpk2fae0gNNOXj-4f9hA.text: I give this place two stars simply because the food is good. Other than that service sucked! Went there with friends to grab lunch around 2pm so not crowded at all. Our waitress was less than happy to serve us. She constantly kept disappearing and we could never find her. The bartender would pour fresh beers and we would almost have to go and get our own beers. Staff was none existent and there was several managers on their computers doing jack!!!  Food was great, but definitely not coming back or inviting anyone to this joint. If you don't have great customer service then doesn't matter about the food because no one wants to visit.

cgLVPm-IohbOWKYDYhQixQ.text: Terrible!! Service sucks and chefs were fired on 3/26/17 for spitting in customers food. I will never go again!!!

WDxSonD-mw1eQT4QeJuitg.text: My wife and I grabbed a late lunch here as we just arrived in town as tourists. Place is a typical bar type so it was not busy at 3:45pm. Staff was friendly. We both ordered burgers and fries. Food was very good and our server checked on us several times. The only complaint was the fries were on the salty side. I would return to have a lunch here for sure.  We both agreed that of all the places to eat in Epicenter, this was the only decent looking place.

qJttwQ4R5JVoMXwk6zf1Pg.text: I went with my sister in law before the ballet on December 18th. When you walk in, it smells like stale cigarettes which is odd since you can't smoke inside. So we sit down at the bar and the bartender looks at us and practically rolls his eyes. I've been in f&b long enough to know he was thinking, "oh great. They're young." We order our drinks and he makes them then immediately gives us our tab and doesn't Check on us or even look at us again. It wasn't busy and other people were being tended to, so I was pretty offended. We intended on staying for a while and I've rarely encountered a golf bartender who doesn't Check build. We were going g to eat but the smell alone was too much. Fortunately, a cute little blonde wAitress was really sweet and ended up closing us out.

WQI85ThNwNYtjm0F6Y458A.text: A terrific place to measure how drunk you buddies are.  Would a self-respecting sober man ride a mechanical bull?  No?  I didn't think so.  The amazing thing about this place is that you never know the type of crowd that may be there.  Football crowds, twenty somethings, thirty/forty somethings, rednecks, Jersey shore wannabe douchebags, bikers, accountants...whoever.  The drinks aren't bad and the prices aren't outrageous...not great...but not that bad.  The music isn't something I'd particularly play...but it seems to keep the lemmings happy.

phydp8iinWtb2ghpWph9PA.text: Went for the playoff game. Great food, particularly the wings. Great place to watch the game. From Norfolk va

foGnbwQhZFJJ1SlLvl32fA.text: Well I would not recommend this place. I am currently here and my table of 5 were the first customers of the day. Initially our server came with waters. Then we ordered sodas and it literally took 15 minutes to get them with only 1 other table of 2 in the restaurant. We ordered our food with the drinks and it took 25 minutes for a salad and 4 burgers. Seriously with 7 total customers?  Then one burger was not done properly. I asked for my salad dressing on the side but it came fully dressed with my lettuce doing the back stroke in the bowl. If it is like this with 7 customers how do they handle crowds??? I would not recommend this place!

t8Z8yHRtuKx-QvyotZOsqA.text: Not a picky eater, but I'm never coming back.   Came on a Tuesday. Sat at the bar and had chicken. The chicken was dry, and took well over half an hour to come out. There were probably only 10 people there max. The sandwich had nothing on it, it was bland, and the drinks were only okay for the price.  The only redeeming quality is that bartenders were attentive, but didn't seem to be the sharpest tools in the shed.

ea31NMVtTo7D6x46tKRFnA.text: If you are reading this review and are on your way to this place TURN THE CAR AROUND.....  The only association this place has with NASCAR is the fact that it is owned by "Junior".   More of a bar than a restaurant - which is evident in the fact that they recently added food to the place to be like the Florida location.   Loud music that goes from Country to Rap to Pop in the blink of an eye.  A couple of TVs playing sports, a mechanical bull, concrete floors, floor to ceiling windows just make this a miss match of a place.   Add to the fact that the food here is TERRIBLE!  If you are so desperate to look at some tits and ass (the waitress wear short shorts and bustiers) spare yourself the $20 and look through a Victoria's Secret Catalogue.

L0vXXyDGeFxvVZI8yLCvHA.text: I also attended the Redskins Rally "and the staff was great . The drink and food was great and thank god for Dale E jr that really take care of the Redskins Nation ' what a bar full to the rim with Redskins Fans . Also met the great Chris Cooley wow!!!!!!

eQRGQWgvXvAol_qfrMS1vQ.text: This review is solely based on the food, and what an utter disappointment it was. I started with the boneless buffalo wings, hot, with ranch dressing. The order came with six, but I should say three and three "little" nuggets. Pathetic. The heat was decent and chicken fresh, just diappointed in the overall order. After that I went with the nachos with chicken.  OMG, please do not bother. The entire plate was covered in cheese, and before you go there I love cheese. This was out of the can, day old cheese that covered every chip so they were completely soggy! There was maybe two slices of chicken underneath all of the cheese, 5 jalepenos and maybe a droplet of lettuce. I love a chip covered in cheese, but when it is so soggy you cannot even get it from the plate to your mouth, that is an issue. I do not plan to return anytime soon..if ever!

cvP3XpokWsW85rY-33YGGw.text: Just so you know ahead of time, they do not offer draught beer. Not one. "Scenery" (as in pretty waitress) is nice. Seems empty for a weekend. If I wasn't a Dale Jr. fan I probably would have chosen pizza on the first level. Just got the check, $4 for domestic bottle. Will not be back.

ZL0ZJESt_gy5dk-155eSbA.text: About the best part of eating here today was the air-conditioning it provided from the August heat. The waitress was ok - refilled drinks without asking, BUT did forget to put in my side order so I had to wait halfway through my lunch for it to come. The food was pretty bad - wings were so fried the outside skin was difficult to eat, but the inside meat was pink! Also the Pepsi was very flat and the onion rings were super salty.

pmLnvg4rA9lPfFWxJOecrQ.text: This place has been around about 7 years and it lost whatever cool factor it had about 2 years in, has had NO updates our renovations unlike other locations in its chain  The concept didn't make sense that it's a "county party bar" that lies about being country as they always play top 40.

k5_CeGiUG3fbwU2wRiaGbw.text: Stopped by here randomly. I ordered chicken tenders and fries and Mac. The Mac and cheese was alright. Desperately under seasoned. The fries were TRASH. The chicken tenders weren't great again, the breading was under seasoned. Overall the food was mediocre and the service was pure hot trash. Our waitress stopped by once told us her name and the other waitress who was shadowing her for training and then poof. Never came back. The waitress in training got us approximately 1 refill. And the kitchen staff ran our food. So we never saw our waitress again till she brought out the bill. I hate to be a stiff tipper but you literally didn't even come touch base with our table after getting the food that you didn't carry out. I understand when places get busy but there was one other table in the whole joint.. WHO GOT THEIR FOOD BEFORE US. so, probably would never go back or recommend this place to anyone

yDvNDfkj6lqC9h2Vaz6WMQ.text: Wanted to watch football and have some drinks which Whiskey River is perfect for except 9 tv's were on the same game. And, not a desirable game! We asked 5 times for the channel to be change on the tv we were in front, apparently only the manager can change the channel. Seems somewhat ridiculous no one else can change the channel!!!

zP0M2wuq43hjl5Ju1zzsrQ.text: My personal favorites were the appetizers (buffalo shrimp, buffalo dip, corn dogs, and jalapeno poppers), the mac and cheese, CORNBREAD, burger and fries, smoked bacon anything, and of course the entire dessert menu.  With barbecue spots popping up all over Charlotte, Whisky has some stiff competition.  They don't claim to have the best barbecue in town, which is appropriate because their barbecue, while good, falls short of the competition.    I posted a full review on the blog, but these are the highlights.

wSRktW5mWqk24TQ7b3njHA.text: I had a supper around 5:15 at Whisky River there were probably 12 customers in this good sized place.   The food was traditional "pub food" and was average in taste.  The prices were great.  I had a cheeseburger with a drink and my bill was under $10.  The downsize was the service.  It took a long time to get waited on after server showed me the table.  I almost walked out after the waitress took my order because getting the food took what seemed like forever.  I actually had stood up and then say the meal coming so I sat back down.  Thankfully the server sat another group of people next to me so I asked her to find my waitress so I could get a refill on my drink.  She says "I'll find her for you.  They tend to be lazy sometimes." Bottom line - Ok food; poor service

IKltU6lbVk-uzFqvczHJVQ.text: This is about as country as I will get! There is usually a 7-10 cover charge, but they have nights and times when you can get in free.  I have been here many times with CLT friends and someone always ends up riding the BULL, which I must say is probably the only reason we go here. I am more of a posh lounge type girl myself.. chill, listen to bands..  lay back on big cushy sofas and drink smart cocktails.. OH.. that is NOT Whiskey River. This is the place to wear your daisy dukes and cowboy boots and listen to pop, r&b, techno and a lot of countryish DJ music while dancing, ordering drinks and hopefully NOT slipping on all the spilled drinks on the floor.   If you want a get down dirty time, you will like it here. If you are looking to chill and be seen.. maybe Suite or Kazba is better for you in the same area..  there is also a great Piano bar above Whiskey called Howl at the Moon that is fun too..

zEPnpHTbB0Uvs1_tEIwpfw.text: Great service! Nachos were great but multiple people at my table mentioned that their food was very salty. Other than that the place is awesome! Love the vibe!

G7m0Wi3AK2X70mJAC52-wg.text: Absolutely terrible service!!!! Took almost 3 hours to get our food, but the food was good. Better places to go than here.

Q2tcceSHzguA3zXW2zwaAQ.text: Went to WR for lunch. Good food and great service from Autumn. 5 stars. Quick, fast and easy for lunch.

X-NsyGoM6yzvYU058z5hqQ.text: Poor ass service. Food is sub par. Won't be coming back. Girls trying to be pretty... Please!

S6RQrkeY0Tu2fC8TKkA0qA.text: The food was below average especially for the price for example the fried pickles were extremely salty. The Texas tequila bacon cheddar burger if it had the bbq sauce on it I could not tell. I will not return.

xpa7baDbsC606j-QiKlObQ.text: Maybe it's because I'm from upstate NY and just don't know any better but I thought Whisky River was underwhelming.  First - is there an actual Whisky River that this place is named after?  Because otherwise their logo looks like someone spelled Whiskey wrong before they sent everything off to the printer and that just bugs the crap out of me.  We went there for lunch during the weekend of the All-Star Race, thinking it would be a happening spot - but there were only two other tables taken.  It was dark in there.  Good for midnight I suppose.  Not so much for noon.  Our server let us sit at our table for about ten minutes too long.  Our drinks sat on the bar for about five minutes too long.  Good bloody mary though.  However, being a bloody mary fanatic, I always ask what's in the mix.  If you're making them you sure as hell better know what's in them.  Our waiter did not.  I ordered the Carolina Pork platter and what was delivered was a pile of plain pulled pork with those fries that are super crunchy with nothing inside of them. That's it.  No presentation.  No garnish.  No roll for the pork...wtf?  I liked the pulled pork very much and sampled all three of the sauces on the table which were all delicious and made the pork that much better.  The fries are just not my thing.  The side salad I ordered was the same as you would get at Applebee's or Chili's.  I thought the bathroom was cool.

X90ziBU91w5ubbzzmbGbXg.text: Love this place, and it's because of the staff. Amber is always so pleasant and wonderfully quick and helpful. Great for lunch, wings are great. I would be remiss if I didn't mention another wonderful server Autumn, always quick with a smile and some quick wit to dispense. Always walk out of here with a smile!
